tool_description: Performs DC voltage calibration measurements across specified ranges and test points, comparing DUT readings against reference standards and calculating measurement errors.

test_points_per_range.description: Number of test points per range (minimum 5)

measurement_cycles.description: Number of measurement cycles for averaging

settling_time.description: Settling time in seconds between measurements

error_messages: Invalid voltage range: Specified voltage range is not supported by calibration system.
Insufficient test points: Minimum 5 test points required per range for statistical validity.
Reference standard overrange: Applied voltage exceeds reference standard capabilities.
DUT reading unstable: Device reading varies beyond acceptable limits during measurement.
Excessive measurement error: DUT error exceeds expected limits, possible malfunction.
Settling time too short: Increase settling time for stable readings.
Too many voltage ranges: Maximum 10 voltage ranges can be calibrated in single session.
usage: Specify voltage ranges to calibrate and optionally adjust test points, measurement cycles, and settling time. Tool systematically applies reference voltages and measures DUT response.

measurement_errors.description: Calculated measurement errors for each test point

ranges_tested.description: List of voltage ranges that were tested

max_error.description: Maximum error found across all test points

within_specification.description: Whether all measurements are within specification limits
